description: Just Another Team's recommendations for Season 17. Recommended for Mouse and Keyboard.
name: Just Another Team's MnK rolls - Season 17

data.description: The same argument as 1k stare arises here. Despite Qd+Snap being the classic option, Moving Target is more useful when sniping as Qd has been nerfed to only affect where you need handling least for a sniper, Draw Speed

The same argument as 1k stare arises here. Despite Qd+Snap being the classic option, Moving Target is more useful when sniping as Qd has been nerfed to only affect where you need handling least for a sniper, Draw Speed
Finally a Solar Precision bow. The classic combo of Archers + Explosive Head works wonders, while Incandescence might be fun with some specific Solar 3.0 builds.
Finally a Solar Precision bow. The classic combo of Archers + Explosive Head works wonders, while Incandescence might be fun with some specific Solar 3.0 builds.
Finally a Solar Precision bow. The classic combo of Archers + Explosive Head works wonders, while Incandescence might be fun with some specific Solar 3.0 builds.

While it’s perk pool isn’t as stacked as the other PvP 140 hcs (Eyasluna, Fatebringer and Austringer), DFA brings Timed Payload to the table, together with the passive stat boosting Perpetual Motion and Adept Mods. A higher AE stat, excellent sight picture and unique perks give it a place in the meta, even if other hand cannons may seem better on paper.

With a good perk pool and solid base stats being boosted by Perp Motion, Horror’s can stand in the S tier of rapid fire pulses.

Horror’s Least brings Kill Clip to the rapid fire pulse rifle party, together with passive stat boosts in Perpetual Motion. With a good perk pool and solid base stats being boosted by Perp Motion, Horror’s can stand in the S tier of rapid fire pulses.

The stasis Rapid Fire of the game, Riptide has some excellent perk combinations for PvE and PvP. It’s slightly let down by not being able to reach 100 recoil direction, but hitting 98 with Arrowhead Break and a Counterbalance Mod is good enough.

The stasis Rapid Fire of the game, Riptide has some excellent perk combinations for PvE and PvP. It’s slightly let down by not being able to reach 100 recoil direction, but hitting 98 with Arrowhead Break and a Counterbalance Mod is good enough. Under Pressure + SWU for PvP lends itself to tearing through groups of Guardians

The stasis Rapid Fire of the game, Riptide has some excellent perk combinations for PvE and PvP. It’s slightly let down by not being able to reach 100 recoil direction, but hitting 98 with Arrowhead Break and a Counterbalance Mod is good enough. Field Prep/ALH + Vorpal makes it an excellent dps Fusion in the Kinetic slot.

Successful Warm Up is a S tier perk on this fusion, letting you use the advantages of the High Impact frame while mitigating the major limiting factor

Iron Banner perks interacting great with this fusion rifle. Iron Grip and Under Pressure work together to grant ~+60 Stability, making this one of the highest Stability High Impact Fusions out there. Successful Warm Up is another S tier perk on this fusion, letting you use the advantages of the High Impact frame while mitigating the major limiting factor

The first non-sunset Adaptive smg to return to the game, Hero’s Burden poses an interesting question. Can you deal with 10 stability (0 if you lack Ricochet) and the massive flinch that grants in order to achieve one of the longest ranges an smg can get? If yes, then go all in on Range with Full Bore and Iron Reach. If no, then you’ve still got a solid option with Hammer forged and Kill Clip that is let down by it’s mediocre 3rd column and 14 zoom

A PvP focused Stasis Fusion in the Kinetic slot, this weapon breaks a few perk placement “rules”. With Arrowhead Break and a Counterbalance mod to reach 100 recoil direction, you can take advantage of Void Elemental Capacitor to reach 60 base stability with the improved charge time of Successful Warm Up

Move over Empirical Evidence and Brass Attacks, Breachlight has a true successor. Rolling many of the perks and combos that made Breachlight such a powerhouse, with a few new perks thrown in for good measure. Demo in the 3rd column along with the option of Subsistence to be combined with a damage perk in MKC or Adrenaline Junkie will let this shine in PvE.

As the first Stasis bow with Headstone, Lunulata could have been great. Unfortunately as a Lightweight bow it doesn’t have enough damage at base to oneshot the crystal, or for general damage. Golden Tricorn can help to mitigate this downside, but in general this is a bow to avoid for PvE and PvP

As the first Stasis bow with Headstone, Lunulata could have been great. Unfortunately as a Lightweight bow it doesn’t have enough damage at base to oneshot the crystal, or for general damage, in general this is a bow to avoid for PvE and PvP

A Kinetic alternative to Shayura’s Wrath, Enyo stands with the smg greats with a solid 15 zoom (the current max outside of specific smgs) and an excellent Encore + MKC roll. Steady Hands is an excellent alternative to Encore to massively improve the “feel” of Enyo after a kill by maxing Handling

A mediocre perk pool on a poor scout archetype is saved from irrelevancy in PvE as being the only solar scout with Adaptive Munitions, but with nothing else. This scout is really only there for Guardians without other, better, solar scouts.

Overflow + Focused Fury comes to the energy slot with the Gallu. While not reaching the heights of Thoughtless thanks to lacking enhanced perks, this is still a solid PvE roll.

This sniper can get some good levels of Stability which when combined with No Distractions give a flinch free experience. (I wouldn’t suggest losing range with Steady Rounds, but the option is there if you want to push the flinch negation as far as the sniper can go)

A unique GL, in that every single shot proc’s Chill Clip and applies 50 stacks of slow. Slow one enemy with a direct hit, and blind everyone around it with Blinding nades. Note that Chill Clip does not proc at all if Ambitious Assassin is the chosen perk, so avoid it and Proximity Nades (Which prevent the grenade from direct hitting at all) if you want to freeze enemies.

A rare PvP fusion that rolls with Rangefinder, putting it as the Adaptive version of Loaded Question for its slightly deeper ohk kills than others of its archetypes. Liquid Coils is an option for ohk at 5 bolts on all resiliences. Controller users are better off maximizing range for fusions in PvP, so a roll with Hammer Forged + Projection Fuse is more worthwhile

Another Void 750, but this blows The Title out of the water with its wide selection of perks. 3rd column Best In Slot is easily Demo, but this can be paired well with practically any final column damage perk. Frenzy for a consistent damage increase, Golden Tricorn for the largest damage increase after fully proccing the perk (Demo helps grenade uptime just for this). Don’t knock Repulsor Brace for a full Void build to assist survivability with relatively consistent 45hp Void Overshields

Another Void 750, but this blows The Title out of the water with its wide selection of perks. 3rd column Best In Slot is easily Demo, but this can be paired well with practically any final column damage perk. Frenzy for a consistent damage increase, Golden Tricorn for the largest damage increase after fully proccing the perk (Demo helps grenade uptime just for this). Don’t knock Repulsor Brace for a full Void build to assist survivability with relatively consistent 45hp Void Overshields

No longer far and beyond the best dps option for the season, Stormchaser still tops the total damage charts, and is still excellent dps. If you can hit all those bolts, Stormchaser is an extremely powerful boss dps choice

No longer far and beyond the best dps option for the season, Stormchaser still tops the total damage charts, and is still excellent dps. If you can hit all those bolts, Stormchaser is an extremely powerful boss dps choice

Thanks to the Desperado nerf, this pulse lacks the killing power of Messenger with Kill Clip, or even NTTE with the perk proc’d. While the relatively poor feel of the gun when stacked up against its direct competitors in the slot stops this pulse from being among the greats, it still has enough going for it to make it a solid enough option if you can't access Messenger or don’t want to run an exotic

A High Impact MG worth getting for PvE. The return of Killing Tally allows this MG to put in excellent work clearing ads when combined with the 40% s16 MG buff against non-boss enemies. This is the current pick for a Solar MG in GMs, whether that’s with Incandescent to pair with a Solar 3.0 build, or with Killing Tally to enhance its add clearing power

A High Impact MG worth getting for PvE. The return of Killing Tally allows this MG to put in excellent work clearing ads when combined with the 40% s16 MG buff against non-boss enemies. This is the current pick for a Solar MG in GMs, whether that’s with Incandescent to pair with a Solar 3.0 build, or with Killing Tally to enhance its add clearing power

A Kinetic option which has Wellspring + Demo is a good pick for PvE, but on an underperforming archetype.
MKC and Harmony can two tap in PvP but are resilience gated to 5 and 6 resilience respectively, which is less than optimal in the current high Resilience meta.

The same argument as 1k stare arises here. Despite Qd+Snap being the classic option, Moving Target is more useful when sniping as Qd has been nerfed to only affect where you need handling least for a sniper, Draw Speed

Another Void 750, but this blows The Title out of the water with its wide selection of perks. 3rd column Best In Slot is easily Demo, but this can be paired well with practically any final column damage perk. Frenzy for a consistent damage increase, Golden Tricorn for the largest damage increase after fully proccing the perk (Demo helps grenade uptime just for this). Don’t knock Repulsor Brace for a full Void build to assist survivability with relatively consistent 45hp Void Overshields
